page.title: 07Clock Tower - Sheerness
page.content: {The clock tower}was built by the Urban District Council to commemorate the coronation in 1902 of Edward VII and Queen Alexandra and has become a feature of the town{landscape.}It was placed at the bottom of Edward Street now called The Broadway. The tower is situated on a concrete island in the centre of the one way {traffic}system. It is the focal point of the town, used as a landmark. During the festive season the clock is boarded up while music is played. It was first restored in June 1977 for the{Silver Jubilee}celebrations for the Queen. Recently the tower has been repainted in red, white, brown and ochre which has aroused many comments from the local people.
